question.text: Which of the following statement is correct about mycorrhiza?

options.text: It is a symbiotic association between fungi and the root of higher plants.
Pinus seeds cannot germinate in their absence.
Plants having such associations show resistance to salinity.
More than one option is correct

solution.text: Fungi are also known to form symbiotic associations with plants (mycorrhiza). Many members of the genus Glomus form mycorrhiza. The fungal symbiont in these associations absorbs phosphorus from soil and passes it to the plant. Plants having such associations show other benefits also, such as resistance to root-borne pathogens, tolerance to salinity and drought, and an overall increase in plant growth and development. Pinus seeds cannot germinate and establish without the presence of mycorrhiza.
